item.title: üíæ Data Product
item.description: I had the opportunity to give a talk at TAK about how product manager should think about data. üëâYou can find the presentation here üëà Addtional Resources I also took the liberty to add some addtional resources to pursue the reflexions and subjects mentioned in the presentation Datalake https://cloud.google.com/solutions/build-a-data-lake-on-gcp Analytics https://segment.com/academy/ https://segment.com/academy/collecting-data/how-to-create-a-tracking-plan/ https://segment.com/academy/intro/ https://www.metabase.com/blog/how-to-ruin-your-life-with-data/index.html https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y5OkEajabr8&t=2s https://www.lemonde.fr/les-decodeurs/article/2019/01/02/correlation-ou-causalite-brillez- Dataviz https://www.d3-graph-gallery.com/ https://www.reddit.com/r/dataisbeautiful/ (exploration) https://www.amazon.fr/Knowledge-Beautiful-Impossible-Invisible-Connections-Visualized/dp/0062188224/ https://www.amazon.fr/Information-Beautiful-New-David-McCandless/dp/0007492898/ en-societe-avec-notre-generateur-aleatoire-de-comparaisons-absurdes_5404286_4355770.html https://www.reddit.com/r/dataisbeautiful/comments/83o8h9/correlation_vs_causation_number_of_ikea_stores_vs/ http://www.

item.title: üå† A Product Vision
item.description: There are a lot of people talking about product out there. Like a lot. How do you know I’m the one you need for your amazing secret project? Well let me introduce you to my product vision. What the f*** is “product” anyway? Basically anything you’re serving your users is product-related. The obvious part is made of UX and UI design of course but not only, your tech stack and the way you use your data (if any) change make go from a meh product to a great product!

item.title: üëæ Freelance Product
item.description: I know it might seem a bit weird to imagine a freelance product manager. Of course for pure tech,product oriented companies such a position often does not make sense but not all companies are mature tech startups üòÖ This is why I’m looking at making an impact along side two kind of teams companies with a low-tech core business looking into entering the digital work üå± small motivated and ambitious small teams trying to shape their first product üöÄ In both cases the aim is to reach out in the best possible way to your first users and maximize for impact and that’s where things get interesting!

item.title: üë∂ Product Management Starter Pack
item.description: (disclaimer) This blog post comes from an email I’ve sent to a couple of my friends who were looking into product management. After many people shared it I though it could be useful to random people who wanted to get to know what PM was about. It would need to be updated and it’s in French. I’ll update that asap I promise ü§û Ce que j’ai fait perso ce n’est absolument pas une v√©rit√© absolue, c’est essayer de me cr√©er une culture produit sur tout ce qui passe sous mon nez.

item.title: üöó Product Manager @Heetch
item.description: Status Permanent contract ‚úÖ January 2018 - September 2019 Started from the bottom… Heetch is one of Uber’s French competitor. Basically the app offers a more social and fun experience than what Uber can offer with a very premium, high end service. I joined in January 2018 as a Junior Ride Product Manager with Walid Ellec as a mentor. During those first months I shipped my first user facing features and started getting ahead of what being a PM meant.

item.title: üå± Co-founder @Rapsodie
üå± Co-founder @Deepdives
item.description: Status Personal Project ‚ò†Ô∏è February 2017 - September 2017 Intro This is part 2 (and last) of my entrepreneurial adventure with the amazing Charlotte Moreau. The first part is our attempt at launching Nabu’s sign language translation wristband. After Class This project’s objective was pretty simple: how could one keep learning about new subjects without being feeling old-school-taught or bored? We started with a first iteration as a messenger bot called Charade (try it out üá´üá∑).

item.title: üå± Co-founder @Nabu
item.description: Status Personal project ‚ò†Ô∏è August 2016 - February 2017 Intro This article is the first part of a 2 article-long adventure with the amazing Charlotte Moreau. I will write a dedicated article about the human adventure itself but let’s focus on the product and achievements for now. Go Bears! When I left Paris for UC Berkeley (with a bricked computed) I never knew the “Jedi wristband” project I was bringing with me would follow such an amazing path.

item.title: üîß Mechanical Engineering intern @Withings
item.description: Status Internship ‚úÖ February 2016 - August 2016 French Touch Withings might be one of France’s finest companies. Founded by serial entrepreneur Eric Carreel (who also founded Inventel, Scuplteo, Zoov…) their products have always pioneered in the health connected devices field. Their historic connected scale has enlightened the way for many more successful products such as watches, sleep monitors etc… During my internship I had the opportunity to work on the Steel HR connected smart watch along with Manon Navellou.

item.title: üîß Mechanical Engineering intern @Dreem
item.description: Status Internship ‚úÖ September 2015 - February 2016 Dream Dreem Rythm’s @Dreem sleep headband aims at helping people sleep better by increase deep sleep duration through noise stimulation. In XXX 2018 they released their third iteration of the headband. I had the opportunity to work on the beta version that was about to be release at the time. During my 6 months internship I worked closely with the head of Mechanical Engineering on many key subjects such as

item.title: About Me üëã
item.description: My name is Rashad but you already knew that, didn’t you? Basically I’m a product addict. I love digging around into all sort of fun and incredible products I can find. From the ones I use everyday to my friends’ startup projects or even low tech random hardware from the 90s’ I find on the streets, every product has something to teach us so let’s find out! I’m always eager to collaborate with new people on new (or old) subjects to deliver great value to people in the world.
